intro: Centaurium babylonicum, commonly known as the Babylonian centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Centaurium babylonicum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
